quiz.title: Unit 3: Motion & Graphs (Quiz 6)
quiz.subtitle: Advanced Motion Scenarios and Synthesis (20 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics
quiz.topic: Complex Problem Solving and Integrated Concepts

questions.question: A car travels 80 km north, then 60 km south. What is the distance traveled?
questions.explanation: Distance = sum of all paths = 80 km + 60 km = 140 km.

questions.question: A car travels 80 km north, then 60 km south. What is the displacement?
questions.explanation: Displacement = 80 km north - 60 km south = 20 km north.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about acceleration?
options: It is always in the direction of motion
It cannot be zero for a moving object
questions.explanation: Acceleration can be negative (deceleration) when an object slows down.

questions.question: A stone is dropped from a cliff. After 2 seconds, its velocity is 19.6 m/s downward. What is its acceleration?
questions.explanation: Acceleration due to gravity is approximately 9.8 m/s² downward.

questions.question: What does a curved line on a position-time graph indicate?
questions.explanation: A curved position-time graph indicates changing velocity (acceleration).

questions.question: A jogger runs 2 km in 15 minutes, then rests for 5 minutes, then runs 1 km in 8 minutes. What is their average speed for the entire period?
questions.explanation: Total distance = 3 km, total time = 28 minutes = 0.467 hours. Average speed = 3 km / 0.467 h ≈ 6.43 km/h ≈ 6 km/h (closest option).

questions.question: Which of the following motions has constant acceleration?
options: A car turning a corner at constant speed
A ball rolling down a straight ramp
questions.explanation: A ball rolling down a straight ramp has constant acceleration due to gravity.

questions.question: A train increases its speed from 30 m/s to 50 m/s over 100 seconds. What is its acceleration?
questions.explanation: Acceleration = (50 - 30) m/s / 100 s = 20 m/s / 100 s = 0.2 m/s².

questions.question: What is the velocity of an object that moves 20 meters east in 4 seconds?
questions.explanation: Velocity = displacement / time = 20 m east / 4 s = 5 m/s east.

questions.question: Which statement about distance and displacement is correct?
options: Displacement can never be greater than distance
Displacement is always greater than distance
questions.explanation: Displacement is the straight-line distance between start and end points, so it can never exceed the total distance traveled.

questions.question: An object moves east at 5 m/s for 3 s, then north at 3 m/s for 4 s. What is the magnitude of its average velocity for the entire trip?
questions.explanation: Displacement east: 5 m/s × 3 s = 15 m. Displacement north: 3 m/s × 4 s = 12 m. Total displacement = √(15² + 12²) = √369 ≈ 19.2 m. Total time = 7 s. Average velocity = 19.2 m / 7 s ≈ 2.74 m/s. (Note: The closest correct calculation is √(15²+12²)/7 = √369/7 ≈ 19.2/7 ≈ 2.74 m/s. The options seem inconsistent. The correct magnitude is approximately 2.74 m/s, which is not listed. However, based on the provided options and typical calculation errors, 4.0 m/s might be selected if one incorrectly averages the speeds.)

questions.question: On a velocity-time graph, a straight line sloping downward to the right indicates:
questions.explanation: A straight line with a negative slope on a velocity-time graph represents a constant negative acceleration (deceleration).

questions.question: A car moving at 20 m/s applies brakes and comes to a stop in 4 seconds. What is the acceleration?
questions.explanation: Acceleration = (0 - 20) m/s / 4 s = -20 m/s / 4 s = -5 m/s².

questions.question: If the position-time graph of an object is a straight line with a slope of zero, the object is:
questions.explanation: A slope of zero on a position-time graph means no change in position over time, so the object is at rest.

questions.question: A particle moves along the x-axis from x = 2 m to x = 8 m, then back to x = 5 m. The total distance traveled is:
The acceleration of an object at the highest point of its trajectory when thrown vertically upward is:
questions.explanation: At the highest point, velocity is zero but acceleration due to gravity is still 9.8 m/s² downward.

questions.question: A car's speed increases from 30 km/h to 60 km/h in 5 seconds. What is its acceleration in m/s²?
questions.explanation: Change in velocity = (60 - 30) km/h = 30 km/h = 8.33 m/s. Acceleration = 8.33 m/s / 5 s ≈ 1.67 m/s².

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT possible?
options: An object has zero velocity and non-zero acceleration
An object has constant speed and changing velocity
An object has constant velocity and changing speed
An object has eastward velocity and westward acceleration
questions.explanation: Constant velocity implies both constant speed and constant direction. Therefore, velocity cannot be constant while speed changes.

questions.question: The slope of a tangent to a curved position-time graph at any point gives the:
questions.explanation: The slope of a tangent to a position-time graph at a specific point represents the instantaneous velocity at that moment.

questions.question: A car travels 3 km north in 4 minutes, then 4 km east in 5 minutes. What is the magnitude of its average velocity for the entire journey?
questions.explanation: Displacement = √(3² + 4²) = 5 km. Total time = 9 min. Average velocity = 5 km / 9 min ≈ 0.56 km/min ≈ 0.7 km/min (closest option).
